Diseases.Symptoms: Sneezing, runny nose, sore throat, cough, fatigue
Diseases.Cause: Viral infection (commonly rhinoviruses)
Diseases.Prevention: Frequent handwashing, avoiding close contact with sick individuals, using tissues when sneezing or coughing

Diseases.Symptoms: Fever, chills, muscle aches, cough, congestion
Diseases.Cause: Influenza viruses
Diseases.Prevention: Annual flu vaccination, frequent handwashing, avoiding close contact with infected individuals

Diseases.Symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue
Diseases.Cause: Insufficient insulin production or insulin resistance
Diseases.Prevention: Type 1 diabetes cannot be prevented. Type 2 diabetes can be reduced through healthy eating, regular exercise, and maintaining a healthy weight

Diseases.Symptoms: Often asymptomatic, headache, vision problems
Diseases.Cause: Genetic factors, unhealthy lifestyle, and other medical conditions
Diseases.Prevention: Regular exercise, healthy diet, maintaining a healthy weight, limiting alcohol, and avoiding smoking

Diseases.Symptoms: Wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness
Diseases.Cause: Chronic inflammation of the airways, triggered by allergens, exercise, or infections
Diseases.Prevention: Avoiding known triggers, using prescribed preventive inhalers, and managing allergies

Diseases.Symptoms: Cough, fever, shortness of breath, chest pain
Diseases.Cause: Bacterial, viral, or fungal infections
Diseases.Prevention: Vaccinations (e.g., pneumococcal vaccine), good hygiene, avoiding smoking

Diseases.Symptoms: Diarrhea, vomiting, stomach cramps, fever
Diseases.Cause: Viral or bacterial infections, contaminated food or water
Diseases.Prevention: Frequent handwashing, proper food handling, and drinking safe water

Diseases.Symptoms: Persistent cough, weight loss, night sweats
Diseases.How to Test: Tuberculin skin test, chest X-ray, sputum test
Diseases.Cause: Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria
Diseases.Prevention: BCG vaccination, avoiding close contact with infected individuals, and using protective measures in high-risk areas

Diseases.Symptoms: Sneezing, itching, runny nose, watery eyes
Diseases.Cause: Immune system overreaction to allergens (e.g., pollen, pet dander)
Diseases.Prevention: Avoid known allergens, use air filters, and take preventive antihistamines if needed

Diseases.Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes
Diseases.Cause: Group A Streptococcus bacteria
Diseases.Prevention: Frequent handwashing, avoiding sharing utensils or food with infected individuals

Diseases.Symptoms: Severe headache, nausea, light sensitivity
Diseases.Cause: Unknown, likely involving genetic and environmental factors
Diseases.Prevention: Managing triggers (e.g., stress, certain foods), regular sleep, and medications as prescribed

Diseases.Symptoms: Frequent urination, burning sensation during urination
Diseases.Cause: Bacterial infection, typically by Escherichia coli
Diseases.Prevention: Wipe front to back after using the restroom, urinate after intercourse, drink plenty of water

Diseases.Symptoms: Fatigue, pale skin, shortness of breath
Diseases.Cause: Iron deficiency, blood loss, or other underlying conditions
Diseases.Prevention: Iron-rich diet, adequate intake of vitamin B12 and folate

Diseases.Symptoms: Fever, cough, shortness of breath, loss of taste/smell
Diseases.Cause: SARS-CoV-2 virus
Diseases.Prevention: Vaccination, wearing masks, frequent handwashing, social distancing

Diseases.Symptoms: Persistent cough, mucus production, shortness of breath
Diseases.Cause: Long-term exposure to irritants (e.g., cigarette smoke)
Diseases.Prevention: Avoid smoking, reduce exposure to lung irritants, and use protective gear in polluted environments

Diseases.Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling
Diseases.Treatment: Pain relief medications, physical therapy, lifestyle changes
Diseases.Cause: Wear and tear of joint cartilage over time
Diseases.Prevention: Maintain a healthy weight, regular exercise, avoid joint injuries

Diseases.Symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, morning stiffness
Diseases.How to Test: Blood tests (e.g., rheumatoid factor), physical examination
Diseases.Cause: Autoimmune disorder causing joint inflammation
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but early diagnosis and treatment can manage symptoms

Diseases.Symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales
Diseases.Cause: Autoimmune disorder leading to rapid skin cell turnover
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but avoiding triggers (e.g., stress, skin injury) can reduce flare-ups

Diseases.Symptoms: Diarrhea, weight loss, abdominal pain
Diseases.How to Test: Blood tests (e.g., tissue transglutaminase antibodies), endoscopy
Diseases.Cause: Immune reaction to gluten
Diseases.Prevention: Cannot be prevented, but avoiding gluten can prevent symptoms

Diseases.Symptoms: Sudden, severe pain in the joints, especially the big toe
Diseases.How to Test: Joint fluid test, blood tests (e.g., uric acid levels)
Diseases.Treatment: Medications to lower uric acid, lifestyle changes
Diseases.Cause: Build-up of uric acid crystals in the joints
Diseases.Prevention: Limit intake of purine-rich foods (e.g., red meat, alcohol), maintain a healthy weight

Diseases.Symptoms: Jaundice, abdominal pain, dark urine
Diseases.Cause: Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection
Diseases.Prevention: Hepatitis B vaccination, avoid sharing needles, practice safe sex

Diseases.Symptoms: Numbness, weakness, balance problems, vision issues
Diseases.Treatment: Disease-modifying therapies, physical therapy, symptomatic treatment
Diseases.Cause: Autoimmune attack on the central nervous system
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but early treatment can help manage symptoms and slow progression

Diseases.Symptoms: Tremors, muscle stiffness, slow movement
Diseases.Cause: Loss of dopamine-producing brain cells
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but a healthy diet and regular exercise may reduce risk

Diseases.Symptoms: Fatigue, joint pain, skin rashes, fever
Diseases.Cause: Autoimmune disorder where the immune system attacks healthy tissue
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but avoiding triggers (e.g., sunlight, infections) can help manage symptoms

Diseases.Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, constipation
Diseases.How to Test: Symptom-based diagnosis, exclusion of other conditions
Diseases.Cause: Unknown, possibly related to gut-brain interaction
Diseases.Prevention: No known prevention, but managing stress and following a balanced diet may reduce symptoms
